div.p: A few days ago, I sent you a letter through the surgeon Buwman, a citizen of Zürich, in which I thanked you for the booklet written against Brentius, which you sent to me, and I earnestly requested you to kindly send us a minister of the word of God, who is so distinguished in doctrine and piety, that we can safely entrust the church of Betschwanden to his faith; for he will receive annually 80 gold coins from the church treasury.
I am surprised that I have not yet received a response from you; perhaps your affairs or the courier were the cause.
Therefore, I wish to ask you to respond to me without delay this week, if your affairs permit.

Everything is somewhat disturbed here; however, I do not doubt that the minister of the word will be safe; for we hope that, since everything in France will be peaceful, everything here will also be peaceful and safe.
May the Lord strengthen your life and make your old age happy for the benefit of the Christian republic.
Fridolin Brunner, minister of the word among the people of Glarus, your most observant.
To the venerable and most learned man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, minister of the word among the people of Zürich, his esteemed lord.
